alert.note: Alert for Nolan; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 5:49PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern and southeastern Nolan, and southwestern Taylor Counties, through 630 PM CDT... At 546 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Maryneal, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 40 mph and hail to penny size, along with frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nolan, Maryneal, Coronados Camp, Camp Butman, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53 and Shep. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm contains frequent cloud to ground lightning. Very heavy rainfall in a short period of time will likely cause ponding of water on roads.
